{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks about a whistling noise during respiration through the nose after rhinoplasty. The patient is recovering well, so post-operative swelling (A) and excessive columellar show (D) are unlikely causes. A septal hematoma causing a perforation (B) could be a possibility, but since the patient has been recovering well, it's less likely. This leaves us with the most likely cause being a deviated septum that is now straight, resulting in altered nasal airflow (C).", "answer_choice": C}
